name: stable
posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: firmly fixed or not likely to move or change

example.eg: If the foundations of the house aren't stable, collapse is possible.
example.egtrans: 如果房子的地基不稳，就有可能倒塌。

example.eg: After several part-time jobs, he's now got a stable job in a bank.
example.egtrans: 干了几份兼职工作之后，他目前在银行找到了一份稳定的工作。

example.eg: The hospital said she was in a stable condition (= not likely to get worse) following the operation.
example.egtrans: 院方说她手术之后情况稳定。

trans_examp.trans_en: A stable person is mentally healthy.
trans_examp.trans_cn: 精神健全的，精神状态稳定的

example.eg: She seems more stable these days.
example.egtrans: 她这些日子看来情绪稳定些了。

trans_examp.trans_en: A stable substance keeps the same chemical or atomic state.
trans_examp.trans_cn: （物质的化学状态或原子状态）稳定的

name: stable
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a building in which horses are kept
a group of racehorses that are owned or trained by one person
trans_examp.trans_cn: （属同一马主或驯马师的）一群赛马

trans_examp.trans_en: a group of people who perform a similar activity and who are trained by the same person or employed by the same organization
trans_examp.trans_cn: （受训于同一人或受雇于同一机构的）一批人

example.eg: During the 1950s, Sun Records' stable of singers included Johnny Cash and Jerry Lee Lewis.
example.egtrans: 20世纪50年代，太阳唱片公司旗下的歌手包括约翰尼•卡什和杰瑞•李•刘易斯。

name: stable
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to keep a horse in a stable
